column4: Hello I need help with some ubuntu wireless usb drivers, can anyone help?
feed google with "0bda:8172 ubuntu" and READ the given results carefully.
did it
troll, you didn't
if you are SO smart please bestow me how on earth you found the answer?
googling above brings at least 5 helpfull results( 2 in german)
I see nothing
stop repeating. if you can't find what others do, we cannot help you
people can help me, YOU are trolling
what does "lspci|grep -i vga" say?
here http://paste.ubuntu.com/574318/
according to nvidia.com your card isn't supported
http://tinyurl.com/yje3plo
so there is no way to get drivers for my card?
what do i do?
use the free nouveau driver
should be installed by default
okay
when i use hardware drivers in system>administrator it won't work and won't let me re-configure my screen resolution
when i use hardware drivers in system>administrator it won't work and won't let me re-configure my screen resolution
cannot help you with that, i don't use any of those proprietary drivers
seems it still uses the old nvidia-driver, try to deinstall it to use the free nouveau driver then. read wiki/forums how to do that (i have no clue about that)
